records.Text: be alive in the distant past, or the distant future?
live in space, or deep under the sea?
lose your sense of taste or your sense of smell?
have super eyesight like a hawk or the ability to breathe underwater?
sleep 8 hours a day every day, or sleep for 3 months straight and then stay awake the rest of the time?
speak every human language, or be able to speak with animals?
win $50,000, or let your best friend win $500,000?
have free Wi-Fi wherever you go, or have free coffee whenever you want?
live in a hot desert, or live somewhere that is really cold?
always have to say exactly what you are thinking, or never speak again?
have the hiccups for the rest of your life, or always feel like you have to sneeze but can't?
be forced to wear wet socks forever, or never wash your hair again?
only be able to whisper, or only be able to shout?
be locked up at an amusement park, or inside a library?
only be known by a few people, or be a popular celebrity?
live without air conditioning and heating, or live without internet?
live somewhere with 4 seasons, or live somewhere it is always summer?
live for 1000 years, or have 10 completely different lives?
have a perfect memory, or be able to completely forget anything you want?
run as fast as a car (100kph), or fly as fast as a turtle walks (1 kph)?
visit the doctor or the dentist?
have a snake as a pet or a spider?
wrestle a lion or fist fight a shark?
know that aliens exist or that humans are alone in the universe?
be stranded on an island with someone you dislike or by yourself?
Bake big batches of brown blueberry bread.
Eddie edited it.
Nine nice night nurses nursing nicely.
Pirates private property.
Real rock wall.
A proper copper coffee pot.
She sells seashells by the seashore.
Tom threw Tim three thumbtacks.
Rolling red wagons.
Busy buzzing bumble bees.
Three short sword sheaths.
I saw a kitten eating chicken in the kitchen.
Shut up the shutters and sit in the shop.
Four fine fresh fish for you.
Roberta ran rings around the Roman ruins.
If a dog chews shoes, whose shoes does he choose?
I saw Susie sitting in a shoeshine shop.
Four furious friends fought for the phone.
The sixth sick sheik's sixth sheep's sick.
We surely shall see the sun shine soon.
